article_title: How Bad Weather Could Affect Stock Prices
article_text:
Bad weather isn’t good for investors.

Rain, wind and clouds, according to a new study, generate “mild depression” that distracts even some of the market’s most sophisticated participants, causing them to delay their responses to financial news.

That is the conclusion of a research project that found that when individual brokerage analysts work in bad weather they respond more slowly to earnings announcements than analysts in...

twitter.description: A study finds that bad weather can distract and delay the markets’ analysts.
twitter.creator: @charliewwells

image.alt: Those ‘clouds on the investment horizon’ are real. How weather affects analysts
